Job Title: Supply Chain Planning Manager

Location: Burlington, MA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Overview

The Supply Chain Planning Manager leads the coordination, compilation and evaluation of a highly accurate volume forecast for our AFH Hardgoods business, at a Customer, Sales Channel, Customer-level and Category/SKU level using historical trends, secondary data sources and sales field information. Responsible for leading the development and execution of strategic plans to deliver Hardgoods supply chain performance to our Coffee Business Unit, with a specific focus on the AFH Commercial business. This role will also lead the coordination and execution of adhoc At Home domestic projects, inclusive of rebox, reclass, and SKU transitions. This role will drive supply chain results in all aspects including forecast accuracy, supply planning, inventory management, customer fulfillment, and productivity. This leader will work cross functionally with Supply Planning, Demand Planning, Finance, Commercial, Marketing, Sales and Transportation teams to ensure the Coffee Business Units strategic initiatives are met.

What you will do:

Partners with Cross functional leaders to develop and implement strategic plans that meet our customers’ demand while improving productivity, quality and operational efficiency.Compile and evaluate a market-based and event-driven forecast for AFH Hardgoods in-line products, new products, business development and market assessment. Understand how sales trends, promotional activity and shipment patterns will affect demand and make appropriate adjustments to forecasts.Ensures operational execution of new product launches and transitions, while also managing end of life programs to minimize obsolescence. Partner with internal customers such as product commercial/marketing, finance, brand management, sale, and customer marketing to collaborate on a forecast recommendation.Track and improve forecast accuracy metrics.Resolve conflict/provide solutions by exercising high levels of influencing, negotiation and communication skills. Be proactive and address issues when they show.Work with Supply Chain functions to establish process improvement programs.Oversee domestic inventory obsolescence management, and partner with finance for monthly tracking. Provide input to the S&OP supply meeting and actively participate throughout the monthly S&OP cycle.Act as a subject matter expert for demand planning amongst team and cross-functionally.Provide system and process training to other key members in organization.


Ensure high performance results of your team by:

Fostering a culture of trust and wellbeing that prioritizes the team and values employee contributionsDriving a shared vision with clear goals and accountability, supported by regular conversations to maximize talentEmbracing diverse perspectives to foster innovation, learning from both successes and failuresEstablishing a safe environment where team members are motivated, heard, and aligned with clear expectations


Requirements

What you must have:

Bachelor’s degree in supply chain management, Business Administration, Statistics, Accounting, Mathematics or similar analytical degree; MBA or MPA degree preferred10+ years’ progressive leadership experience in product supply in the consumer product industry.Ability to create and maintain relationships, both externally and internally.Excellent communication skills, and Executive level presentation competency. Ability to be flexible and drive for results, even when all of the requirements have not been defined.Proven experiences with successfully implementing best in class demand planning processes.Strong deductive reasoning, statistical analysis, mathematical and communication skills.Ability to occasionally travel; work a flexible schedule as needed.


Company Overview

Keurig Dr Pepper (NASDAQ: KDP) is a modern beverage company with a bold vision built to deliver growth and opportunity. We operate with a differentiated business model and world-class brand portfolio, powered by a talented and engaged team that is anchored in our values. We work with big, exciting beverage brands and the #1 single-serve coffee brewing system in North America at KDP, and we have fun doing it!

Together, we have built a leading beverage company in North America offering hot and cold beverages together at scale. Whatever your area of expertise, at KDP you can be a part of a team that’s proud of its brands, partnerships, innovation, and growth. Will you join us?

We strive to be an employer of choice, providing a culture and opportunities that empower our team of ~28,000 employees to grow and develop. We offer robust benefits to support your health and wellness as well as your personal and financial well-being. We also provide employee programs designed to enhance your professional growth and development, while ensuring you feel valued, inspired and appreciated at work.

Keurig Dr Pepper is an equal opportunity employer and affirmatively seeks diversity in its workforce. Keurig Dr Pepper recruits qualified applicants and advances in employment its employees without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, disability or association with a person with a disability, medical condition, genetic information, ethnic or national origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Experience Level (if available): None
